Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Anxiety and Pain Perception in Thyroid FNAB

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing thyroid FNAB. This prospective randomised controlled trial was conducted at the Endocrinology Clinic of Sultan Abdulhamid Training and Research Hospital

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the correlation between situational anxiety, pain perception, and non-diagnostic cytology results.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of non-diagnostic cytology results, measured immediately post-procedure.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 119 patients were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 119 patients were randomised, with 98 females and 21 males.

Result_Outcome.evidence: High pre-procedural anxiety (OR:3.09, 95% CI:1.07-8.94, p=0.037) and VAS score (OR:1.57, 95% CI: 1.17-2.10, p=0.002) were associated with non-diagnostic results.
